uniques.name: Epic of Battle
uniques.value: +3 Culture, +1 Happiness and +1 Production from conquered cities. Generals give a +15% combat strength against cities to nearby units.

uniques.name: Akkadian Library
uniques.value: Replaces Library: Costs no maintenance, +1 Science. Costs less to produce (40 hammers vs. 50).

uniques.name: Laputtu
uniques.value: Replaces Spearmen. 13 Strength (vs. 11). Doubles Workers’ improvement speeds on tiles it is stationed.

uniques.name: Saint Elesbaan's Blessing
uniques.value: Cities emanate 33% additional Religious Pressure if a Trade Route currently departs from it.

uniques.name: Rock-Hewn Church
uniques.value: Replaces the Quarry (and may only be built on Quarry resources), but available at Mining. Provides +2 Faith and +1 Production. +1 Faith at Theology.

uniques.name: King Ezana's Stele
uniques.value: Replaces National Epic (but requires a Shrine in every city to build instead of Monuments). Provides +4 Culture and Faith in addition to the base stats. Grants +2 Food, +1 Production, +1 Gold and +1 Faith from all Shrines in the empire.

uniques.name: Manifest Destiny
uniques.value: All land military units have +1 Sight. 50% discount when purchasing tiles.

uniques.name: Minutemen
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the American civilization. Replaces the Musketmen.

uniques.name: Pioneer
uniques.value: Pioneer: Replaces Settler. Has the same combat and movement properties as the Scout (preventing instant capture) and may Settle.

uniques.name: Ships of the Desert
uniques.value: Caravans gain 50% extended range. Your trade routes spread the home city's religion twice as effectively. Oil resources are doubled.

uniques.name: Camel Archer
uniques.value: Unique ranged mounted unit of the Arabian civilization. Replaces the Knight. Requires Horses. (20 Ranged Strength (from 21), 14 Melee (from 17))

uniques.name: Bazaar
uniques.value: Unique building of the Arabian civilization. Replaces the Market.

uniques.name: Pride of the People
uniques.value: Build pastures and farms twice as fast.

uniques.name: Gaucho
uniques.value: Replaces Horseman (and upgrades to Cavalry), but available at Gunpowder. 5 Movement, 20 Strength. Identical Production cost to the Knight. +200% Combat Bonus when Flanking. May Withdraw from Melee attacks (50% chance). Capable of building Pastures and Farms in 2 turns.

uniques.name: Ocupada Estable
uniques.value: +1 Food from Pastures and +1 Production from Maize in addition to the regular benefits of the Stable.

uniques.name: Splendor of the Caucasus
uniques.value: +1 Food, +2 Production and +1 Gold from Mountains (including mountain Natural Wonders - i.e. Kilimanjaro, Uluru, Mt. Fuji, Mt. Sinai, Mt. Kailash, Rock of Gibraltar and Sri Pada).

uniques.name: Sparapet
uniques.value: Replaces Horseman. Requires 80 Production and 2 Horse resources. 17 Combat Strength and radiates the Great General Combat Bonus to nearby allies. Does not obsolete.

uniques.name: Darbas
uniques.value: Replaces Observatory, providing +4 Science and +1 Culture. +3 culture and +4 science on Mountains (including mountainous Natural Wonders).

uniques.name: Siege Warfare
uniques.value: +1 movement for all siege units. Free Great Writer at Philosophy, and receive a free Great Work of Writing upon completion of the Royal Library in the Capital.

uniques.name: Royal Library
uniques.value: +1 Culture, +1 Science in addition to normal behavior.

uniques.name: Siege Tower
uniques.value: Unique siege unit of the Assyrian civilization. Replaces the Catapult.

uniques.name: Dreamtime
uniques.value: +5 Faith from Natural Wonders.

uniques.name: Ngangkari
uniques.value: Replaces Worker. Starts with Medic I and Medic II promotions. Has +1 movement, can build workboats (4 turn build). Will not consume the unit.

uniques.name: Convict Penitentiary
uniques.value: Replaces Constabulary. Available at Machinery (instead of Banking). Provides +1 Gold, +1 Production, +5% Gold, and +5% Production

uniques.name: Diplomatic Marriage
uniques.value: Can spend Gold to annex or puppet a City-State that has been your ally for 5 turns.

uniques.name: Hussar
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Austrian civilization. Replaces the Cavalry. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Coffee House
uniques.value: Unique building of the Austrian civilization. Much cheaper to construct (100 vs 166.7). Replaces the Windmill.

uniques.name: Justice of Saladin
uniques.value: All cities receive a free Burial Tomb upon capture. +25% Improvement construction rate.

uniques.name: Madrasah
uniques.value: Replaces University. +2 Faith from Madrasah, +1 Science from Flood Plains, +2 Science from Oases.

uniques.name: Mamluk
uniques.value: Replaces Knight. 20 Strength, +50% vs Melee units, +25% vs Gunpowder units. Slightly more expensive to produce.

uniques.name: Sacrificial Captives
uniques.value: Gains Culture for the empire from each enemy unit killed.

uniques.name: Floating Gardens
uniques.value: Unique building of the Aztec civilization. Replaces the Water Mill. +10% Food, +1 Food for each worked Lake and Oasis, +2 Food and +1 Production, City must border fresh water

uniques.name: Jaguar
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the Aztec civilization. Replaces the Warrior. Available right from the start of the game.

uniques.name: Ingenuity
uniques.value: Receive a free Great Scientist when you discover Philosophy. Earn Great Scientists 25% faster.

uniques.name: Walls of Babylon
uniques.value: Unique building of the Babylonian civilization. Replaces the Walls.

uniques.name: Bowman
uniques.value: Unique ranged unit of the Babylonian civilization. Replaces the Archer.

uniques.name: Colonialist Riches
uniques.value: +1 Production from Plantations. +1 Gold from Strategic Resources.

uniques.name: Stade
uniques.value: Replaces Zoo. +3 Happiness, +1 Culture, +1 Gold. Cheaper to construct.

uniques.name: Force Publique
uniques.value: Replaces Great War Infantry. 51 Strength (vs. 50), has Drill I and Charge.

uniques.name: The Great Trek
uniques.value: +1 Food from non-fresh water farms, +1 Culture from farms after the discovery of Fertilizer

uniques.name: Staatsmuseum
uniques.value: Replaces Opera House. +3 Culture, has a Great Artist slot.

uniques.name: Voortrekker
uniques.value: Replaces Great War Infantry. Cheaper to build. 50 Strength, +25% Strength defending, heals completely upon killing a unit. Capable of building Farms in 2 turns.

uniques.name: Chemist
uniques.value: Upon the discovery of Chemistry, expending a Great Artist improves the yield of Mines with +1 Production and expending a Great Writer improves them with +1 Food instead. [To confirm: These yields are swapped, do not stack and only work on artists and writers, not any unique or normal other Great People]

uniques.name: Comparsa Folklorica
uniques.value: Replaces the Great Musician. Has 4 movement. In addition to the normal usages of a Great Musician, this unit may also be expended to start a Golden Age, or to generate Culture.

uniques.name: Colorado
uniques.value: Replaces the Anti-tank Rifle. 40 Combat strength. Available at Dynamite. This unit is weaker against armored units (+100% bonus versus +200%), but receives +2 combat strength for every 5 excess happiness in the empire [rounds up, updates whenever a unit is moved, or during turn rolls].

uniques.name: Carnival
uniques.value: Tourism output is +100% during their Golden Ages. Earn Great Artists, Musicians, and Writers 100% faster during their Golden Ages.

uniques.name: Pracinha
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Brazilian civilization. Replaces the Infantry. 80 Strength and Foreign Lands bonus (+20% Combat Strength in foreign territory) on top of its normal promotions.

uniques.name: Brazilwood Camp
uniques.value: Now available at Bronze Working (instead of Machinery). Provides +1 Production (instead of +2 Gold). Gains +2 Gold at Machinery and +2 Culture at Acoustics.

uniques.name: Austronesian Thalassocracy
uniques.value: Start with a Nelayan.

uniques.name: Nelayan
uniques.value: Replaces Work Boat. Has 10 Combat Strength. Can build Fishing Boats and Kampong Ayer in 4 Turns.

uniques.name: Kampong Ayer
uniques.value: Requires Optics. Can be built on any coastal tile touching land. Provides +1 Food, +1 Culture and +1 Gold and an additional +1 Culture and +1 Gold after discovering Flight.

uniques.name: Cyrillic Script
uniques.value: Writer Specialists yield +3 Science, Science buildings receive +1 Culture

uniques.name: Konnitsa
uniques.value: Replaces the Knight. Similar to an Impi, performs a Ranged attack when initiating combat. Gains a +25% Combat Bonus vs. Gunpowder units.

uniques.name: Khambar
uniques.value: Replaces Granary. 10% cheaper to construct. In addition to the typical perks, yields +1 Gold from Wheat and Cattle resources.

uniques.name: Pyu City States
uniques.value: +1 Happiness in every City.

uniques.name: Akyat Cannon
uniques.value: Replaces Cannon, available at Gunpowder. Has the same stats (that includes cost) as a Trebuchet but 3 Range.

uniques.name: Kyawwat
uniques.value: Replaces Stoneworks. Extends bonuses to Salt and Iron, but does not require any resources to construct.

uniques.name: Patriarchate of Constantinople
uniques.value: Choose one more Belief than normal when you found a Religion.

uniques.name: Hippodrome
uniques.value: Replaces Amphitheater. Provides +2 Faith, +2 Culture, +1 Happiness.

uniques.name: Cataphract
uniques.value: Unique mounted unit of the Byzantine civilization. Replaces the Horseman. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Canadian Fur Trade
uniques.value: +2 Gold from Camps, +2 Gold and +1 Culture from Lakes and Oases.

uniques.name: Combat Engineer
uniques.value: Replaces Rifleman. Available at Industrialization. Identical Strength, but +1 Movement. May construct Roads, Railroads, and Forts, and clear Forests, Jungles and Marsh tiles.

uniques.name: Tim Horton’s
uniques.value: Replaces Stock Exchange. In addition to the normal effects of Stock Exchange provides +1 Gold on River tiles worked by this city and +2 Happiness. Marginally cheaper to construct.

uniques.name: Phoenecian Heritage
uniques.value: All coastal Cities get a free Harbor. Units may now enter Mountains without a General.

uniques.name: Cothon
uniques.value: Replaces Lighthouse. +1 Food, Production and Gold in addition to normal effects of a Lighthouse.

uniques.name: African Forest Elephant
uniques.value: No longer has increased Production cost. If attacking from higher elevation (Hills to flat land, Mountain to non-Mountain), gains +20% Combat Strength and knocks enemies back (Heavy Charge)

uniques.name: Druidic Lore
uniques.value: +1 Faith per city with an adjacent unimproved Forest. Bonus increases to +2 Faith in Cities with 3 or more adjacent unimproved Forest tiles.

uniques.name: Silversmith
uniques.value: Replaces the Mint. Provides +2 Production and +1 Gold (instead of +2) and does not require resources to construct, but retains the typical perks of a Mint. Less costly to produce (50 hammers vs 66).

uniques.name: Pictish Warrior
uniques.value: Replaces Warrior (instead of the Swordsman). 10 Strength (vs. 8). Earn 100% of your foe’s Combat Strength as Faith from kills. Upgrades into Swordsmen (instead of Spearmen) from Ruins. (Warriors upgraded in this fashion will not suffer a Strategic Resource penalty and retain their Faith-earning promotion, but will lose these qualities upon further upgrade.)

uniques.name: By Reason or by Force
uniques.value: Fishing Boats and Dry Docks instantly claim all surrounding neutral tiles. Receive a free Great Admiral at the Compass technology. Melee & Gunpowder units reduce nearby enemy Naval units' and Naval Melee units reduce nearby enemy Land units’ combat strength by 25%.

uniques.name: Cooperative
uniques.value: Replaces the Factory. Only 1 is needed to unlock your ideology. No maintenance cost.

uniques.name: Cardoen
uniques.value: Replaces the Helicopter Gunship. May take Cities. Has a +100% combat bonus against ranged attacks.

uniques.name: Art of War
uniques.value: The Great General combat bonus is increased by 15%, and their spawn rate is increased by 50%.

uniques.name: Paper Maker
uniques.value: Unique building of the Chinese civilization. Replaces the Library.

uniques.name: Chu-Ko-Nu
uniques.value: A Chinese unique ranged unit. Replaces the Crossbowman.

uniques.name: Cuba Pride (or something)
uniques.value: For every other Civilization you have met, receive +1 Culture for every 8 Culture their Capital generates each turn. Upon selecting your first Tenet in an Ideology, immediately receive 2 Guerrilleros. Receive 50% less unhappiness from ideology pressure. [Culture bonus does not take % modifiers into account]

uniques.name: Guerrillero
uniques.value: Replaces the GWI. Unlocks after choosing your first Tenet in an ideology. 3 movement. 20% Cheaper to construct, but weaker (44 vs 50 melee strength).

uniques.name: Dance Hall
uniques.value: Replaces the Opera house. +1 Happiness, +15% production towards military units and +4 Culture if the Great work of Music is filled [updates every turn roll].

uniques.name: Viking Fury
uniques.value: Gains +1 Production from Fish Resources.

uniques.name: Berserker
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Danish civilization. Replaces the Longswordsman. Requires Iron.

uniques.name: Longship
uniques.value: Replaces Trireme. +2 Movement, sharing movement with embarked units that start their turn on the same tile as the Longship.

uniques.name: Monument Builders
uniques.value: +15% (from 20%) Production when building Wonders

uniques.name: Burial Tomb
uniques.value: Egyptian unique ranged mounted unit. Replaces the Chariot Archer.

uniques.name: War Chariot
uniques.value: Unique building of the Egyptian civilization. Requires Shrine. Replaces the Temple.

uniques.name: Sun Never Sets
uniques.value: +2 Movement for all naval units. Receives 1 extra Spy.

uniques.name: Longbowman
uniques.value: Unique ranged unit of the English civilization. Replaces the Crossbowman.

uniques.name: Ship of the Line
uniques.value: Unique ranged naval unit of the English civilization. Replaces the Frigate. Requires Iron. 30 Ranged Combat (from 35), 25 Melee (from 30)

uniques.name: Spirit of Adwa
uniques.value: Combat bonus (+20%) when fighting units from a Civilization with more Cities than Ethiopia.

uniques.name: Stele
uniques.value: Unique building of the Ethiopian civilization. Replaces the Monument. Available right from the start of the game.

uniques.name: Mehal Sefari
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Ethiopian civilization. Replaces the Rifleman. Near Capital Combat Bonus increased to 50% (from 30%). Bonus falloff increased to -5% per tile (from -3% per tile).

uniques.name: Finnish Mobility
uniques.value: All Melee and Mounted Units have a 50% increased flanking bonus. +1 Culture from unimproved Forest tiles.

uniques.name: Sissi
uniques.value: Replaces Machine Gun. 3 Movement. Ignores terrain cost and receives a +25% Combat Bonus vs. Armored units. Does not spend movement on pillaging tiles, but cannot attack twice. 60 Ranged Strength, 50 Melee (vs. 60).

uniques.name: Sauna
uniques.value: Replaces Shrine: +2 Culture from Lake tiles. Units trained in Cities with a Sauna heal +10 HP inside friendly territory.

uniques.name: City of Light
uniques.value: +1 Culture in the Capital, increasing by an additional +15 upon the discovery of Acoustics. Theming bonuses are doubled in the Capital.

uniques.name: Chateau
uniques.value: Cannot be built on a resource tile. Receives +2 Science and +1 Science at the Free Thought policy in addition to its regular yields.

uniques.name: Musketeer
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the French civilization. Replaces the Musketman.

uniques.name: Holy Roman Empire
uniques.value: +1 Faith from Farms. Frankish Units receive +25% Movement when traveling along friendly and neutral Roads and Railroads.

uniques.name: Mead Hall
uniques.value: Replaces Colosseum. +3 Happiness, +1 Culture

uniques.name: Seaxman
uniques.value: Replaces Longswordsman. Available at Chivalry. 22 Strength (vs. 21). Arrives trained with the Cover I and Amphibious promotions.

uniques.name: Oppidum of Bribacte
uniques.value: Receive a free Murus Gallicus in the original Capital.

uniques.name: Noble Swordsmen
uniques.value: Replaces the Longswordsman. 20 Strength (vs. 21). Gains a +33% Combat Bonus when initiating combat and a +50% Bonus in Forests. Does not require Iron resources. Becomes obsolete at Rifling (instead of Gunpowder) and upgrades into Riflemen.

uniques.name: Murus Gallicus
uniques.value: Replaces Walls. Slightly cheaper (44 Production vs. 50) and better defense (+6 vs. +5). +1 Production and +1 Happiness; +1 Production after researching Metal Casting.

uniques.name: Precision Engineering
uniques.value: +1 Science and Production from Workshops, Windmills, Factories and Hydro Plants. +33% faster Great Engineer generation.

uniques.name: Hanse
uniques.value: Unique building of the German civilization. Requires Market. Replaces the Bank.

uniques.name: Panzer
uniques.value: Unique armored unit of the German civilization. Replaces the Tank. Requires Oil.

uniques.name: Golden Conquest
uniques.value: Receive a free Great Artist upon completing a Jarliq in a City. After the discovery of Philosophy, receive a free Jarliq in the Capital.

uniques.name: Ulan
uniques.value: Replaces Pikeman. Behaves as a Mounted unit and requires a Horse resource. +2 Movement. Arrives trained with Ambush Formation I and does not receive a penalty vs. Cities.

uniques.name: Jarliq
uniques.value: Replaces Courthouse. Requires Writing. Additionally provides +3 Gold and Science. Does not require Gold maintenance.

uniques.name: Drauhtinon
uniques.value: Melee and Gunpowder units receive +1 Movement and heal 25 HP after killing an enemy.

uniques.name: Gadrauht
uniques.value: Replaces Longswordsman. 22 Strength (vs. 21). Cheaper to produce, and does not require Iron. Moves along enemy Roads unimpeded.

uniques.name: Harjis
uniques.value: Available at Mining. Must be adjacent to a Luxury resource (but not on a Luxury resource). Cannot be built adjacent to one another. Provides +1 Production. +1 Production upon the discovery of Iron Working, Gunpowder and Dynamite.

uniques.name: Hellenic League
uniques.value: City-State Influence degrades at half and recovers at twice the normal rate.

uniques.name: Odeon
uniques.value: Replaces the Ampitheater. +4 Culture, +1 Gold, and includes a slot for a Great Writer Specialist.

uniques.name: Hoplite
uniques.value: A Greek unique front-line unit. 14 Strength (from 13, vs. 11). Replaces the Spearman.

uniques.name: Bronze and Iron
uniques.value: +1 Gold from Mines. Starts with Mining.

uniques.name: Lion’s Gate
uniques.value: Replaces Walls. +2 Gold and +2 Culture.

uniques.name: Heavy Chariot
uniques.value: Replaces Chariot Archer. Identical Ranged Strength and 3 Movement (vs. 4) , but 10 Melee Strength (vs. 5). Gains a +20% Combat Bonus when enemies initiate combat.

uniques.name: Scourge of God
uniques.value: Raze Cities at double speed. Borrow City names from other in-game Civs. Start with Animal Husbandry technology. +1 Production per Pasture.

uniques.name: Qara U’y
uniques.value: Replaces Stable. In addition to typical perks, yields +1 Faith from Horses. Provides +2 Horses (like Recycling Center).

uniques.name: Horse Archer
uniques.value: Unique Hunnic early ranged mounted unit. Replaces the Chariot Archer. Requires Horses

uniques.name: Verszerzodes
uniques.value: +1 Production and Culture from Defensive Buildings (Walls, Castles, Arsenals, Military Bases).

uniques.name: Black Arquebusier
uniques.value: Replaces Musketman. Identical strength, but is capable of setting up to perform Ranged attacks (similar to a Siege unit). Arrives with Shock I.

uniques.name: Orszaggyules
uniques.value: Replaces the Palace. In addition to the regular bonuses of the Palace, a second Orszaggyules may be constructed to move the Capital, and the original can be sold and moved as well. The Capital is located in the last City to build an Orszaggyules. Provides +25% faster Great Person Generation and +10% Production towards buildings. +3 Food, Production and Culture at Chivalry. Requires Mathematics to construct.

uniques.name: Great Andean Road
uniques.value: Units ignore terrain costs when moving into any tile with Hills. No maintenance costs for improvements in Hills; half cost elsewhere.

uniques.name: Terrace Farm
uniques.value: Unique improvement of the Incan civilization. Requires Construction.

uniques.name: Slinger
uniques.value: Unique ranged unit of the Incan civilization. Replaces the Archer. 5 Melee Strength (up from 4).

uniques.name: Population Growth
uniques.value: Unhappiness from number of Cities doubled, Unhappiness from number of Citizens halved.

uniques.name: Mughal Fort
uniques.value: Unique building of the Indian civilization. Requires Walls. Replaces the Castle. +4 Culture, +2 Happiness, +2 Tourism at Flight

uniques.name: War Elephant
uniques.value: Unique ranged mounted unit of the Indian civilization. Replaces the Chariot Archer. +50% strength against Melee units.

uniques.name: Spice Islanders
uniques.value: Unique Luxuries appear in the first 3 Coastal Cities (regardless of continent).

uniques.name: Candi
uniques.value: Unique building of the Indonesian civilization. Replaces the Garden. May be built in all cities.

uniques.name: Kris Swordsman
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Indonesian civilization. Replaces the Swordsman. Requires Iron. 15 Combat Strength (up from 14) and bad outcomes removed.

uniques.name: Gaelic Revival
uniques.value: +2 Happiness from all National Wonders (excluding the Palace). +15% Production towards constructing buildings required for National Wonders.

uniques.name: Fenian
uniques.value: Replaces Rifleman. Significantly cheaper (110 vs. 150 Production). Gains a +20% Combat Bonus in friendly territory.

uniques.name: Irish Pub
uniques.value: Replaces Zoo. In addition to the typical perks, provides +3 Food in the City, and costs no Gold maintenance. +1 Production from Wine, Tea and Coffee resources in the City.

uniques.name: The Great Warpath
uniques.value: Units move through Forest and Jungle in friendly territory as if they were Roads. These tiles can be used to establish 20xCityConnection5 City Connections upon researching The Wheel. Caravans move along Forest and Jungle as if they were Roads.

uniques.name: Longhouse
uniques.value: +10% Production (like regular Workshop), also extends Production yield to Jungle tiles. Cheaper to construct (50 vs. 80 Production).

uniques.name: Mohawk Warrior
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the Iroquois civilization. Replaces the Swordsman. Has 15 Combat Strength (up from 14).

uniques.name: The Promised Land
uniques.value: +1 Culture from Pastures.

uniques.name: Maccabee
uniques.value: Replaces Swordsman. Significantly cheaper (40 vs. 50 Production). Earn 100% of foe’s Combat Strength as Faith upon kill.

uniques.name: Yeshiva
uniques.value: Replaces the Temple. More expensive (80 vs. 67 Production), but grants +1 Food and Production in the City.

uniques.name: Rinascimento
uniques.value: +1 Culture from Specialists. Enter a Golden Age upon completion of a Policy Tree.

uniques.name: Pittore
uniques.value: Replaces Great Artist. Golden Ages started by a Pittore last for 9 turns (vs. 6), scaling to 14 turns with Chichen Itza or Freedom 3; scaling to 14 turns with both.

uniques.name: Basilica
uniques.value: Replaces Museum. Available at Industrialization. +20% faster Great Person generation. Contains 2 slots for Great Artist Specialists, and generates 2 Great Artist Points each turn.

uniques.name: Bushido
uniques.value: Units fight as though they were at full strength even when damaged. +1 Culture from each Fishing Boat and +2 Culture from Atolls.

uniques.name: Dojo
uniques.value: Replaces Barracks. +2 science. Land units built in a City with a Dojo gain a unique promotion, granting a +10% Combat Bonus.

uniques.name: Samurai
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Japanese civilization. Replaces the Longswordsman. Requires Iron.

uniques.name: The Holy Land
uniques.value: +1 Faith from Luxury Resources.

uniques.name: Crusader
uniques.value: Replaces Longswordsman. 17 Strength, slightly cheaper to produce. Available at Theology. Receives Faith from kills and gains a +20% Combat Bonus outside of friendly territory. May enter rival territory without Open Borders.

uniques.name: Outremer
uniques.value: Replaces Courthouse. Eliminates extra Unhappiness, and provides +2 Culture, +2 Happiness, +2 Faith. Requires no Gold maintenance.

uniques.name: Grand Baray of Angkor
uniques.value: Receive a free Baray in the capital.

uniques.name: Ballista Elephant
uniques.value: Replaces Crossbowman. 14 Ranged Strength (vs. 18), 20 Melee (vs. 13), 3 Moves, 2 Range, classified as a Mounted Ranged unit. Arrives with the Feared Elephant promotion.

uniques.name: Baray
uniques.value: Replaces Garden. In addition to usual effects, 10% of Food is carried over after a Citizen is born. +2 Food and +2 Faith at Drama and Poetry.

uniques.name: Merchant Economy
uniques.value: +5% Growth for each foreign Trade Route in the City. +4 Gold from internal Trade Routes.

uniques.name: Dhow
uniques.value: Replaces Caravel, available at Compass. Costs less to produce, but has 17 Strength (vs. 20). Arrives with Boarding Party I.

uniques.name: Coral Port
uniques.value: Replaces Workshop. Yields less Production itself, but provides +2 Production from Coral, +1 Food from Fish, +1 Culture from Pearls and Crabs, and +2 Gold from Whales. Provides +1 Production from Hardwood, too.

uniques.name: Heart of Africa
uniques.value: Borders grow 33% faster.

uniques.name: Ngao Mbeba
uniques.value: Replaces Swordsman. 15 Strength, gaining a +100% Combat Bonus when defending against Ranged attacks. Cannot attack.

uniques.name: Slave Market
uniques.value: Replaces Colosseum. Subtracts 1 Population in the City upon completion. Provides +4 Production and +5 Gold, with an additional +3 Production and +2 Gold at Industrialization. Does not provide Happiness.

uniques.name: Scholars of the Jade Hall
uniques.value: +1 Science from Specialists, +1 Science from the Palace.

uniques.name: H’wacha
uniques.value: Unique ranged unit of the Korean civilization. Cheaper to construct (67 hammers vs. 80). Replaces the Trebuchet.

uniques.name: Turtle Ship
uniques.value: Unique naval unit of the Korean civilization. Replaces the Caravel.

uniques.name: Baltic Mythology
uniques.value: All Prophets generated or received by Lithuania become the Krivis, which can create the Sacred Grove, but cannot spread or found a Religion.

uniques.name: Pestininkas
uniques.value: Replaces the Pikeman. Identical combat capabilities, but is significantly cheaper to construct (40 Production vs. 60).

uniques.name: Sacred Grove
uniques.value: Provides +1 Food, Production, Culture, Science and Faith. Each yield increases by +1 upon the discovery of Philosophy, Theology, Acoustics, Archeology, Plastics, Computers, and the Internet (for a total of 8 of each yield).

uniques.name: Vilnius Temple
uniques.value: Behaves like a Grand Temple but can be built without having a religion and may be built outside of a Holy City. 25% cheaper to construct (62 hammers vs. 82).

uniques.name: Macedonian Discipline
uniques.value: Barracks and Armories provide +1 Food, Culture and Happiness. Receive a free Hetairoi at Horseback Riding.

uniques.name: Hetairoi
uniques.value: Replaces the Great General. 15 Combat Strength, 4 Movement. Requires a Horse resource. (If no Horses are available when this unit is generated, it receives a Strategic Resource penalty). Receives the Great Generals II, March, Charge, and Heavy Charge promotions for free. Can upgrade to Knight, but will lose its ability to create Citadels.

uniques.name: Sarissophoroi
uniques.value: Replaces Pikeman. Available at Philosophy instead of Civil Service. Weaker, (14 Strength vs. 16), but gains a +100% Combat Bonus (vs. +50%) against Mounted units.

uniques.name: Sacred Hills of Imerina
uniques.value: +6 Culture and Faith from Holy Sites.

uniques.name: Mpiambina
uniques.value: Replaces Inquisitor (after buying a Inquisitor). Ranged unit with 8 Melee Strength and 14 Ranged. Receives a promotion from a unique selection after their first round of combat:

uniques.name: Rova
uniques.value: Replaces Walls. In addition to the defensive perks, provides +1 Happiness and +3 Faith.

uniques.name: Eight Banners
uniques.value: All Manchu Mounted (and Armored) units receive the Volley promotion (+50% Combat Bonus vs. Fortified units and Cities) and require no Gold maintenance.

uniques.name: Canton Factory
uniques.value: Replaces Bank. +35% Gold (vs. +25%), +2 Gold, 2 Merchant Specialist slots (vs. 1), and nearly half as costly to construct (67 Production vs. 134).

uniques.name: Qianlong Cavalry
uniques.value: Replaces Cavalry. Faster (5 Movement vs. 4) and generates Great Generals more quickly from combat (Great Generals I).

uniques.name: Mana of Tumatauenga
uniques.value: During the first 5 turns, all units (except Recon units) receive +2 Movement and +1 Sight. After this, units receive +2 Movement during the first turn they appear.

uniques.name: Maori Warrior
uniques.value: 9 Strength (vs. 8). Same promotion as the Polynesians.

uniques.name: Pa
uniques.value: Available at Engineering. +2 Food and +1 Faith. May only be built on Hills without resources and cannot be constructed adjacent to one another. +1 Food at Civil Service and Fertilizer. +40% Defensive bonus to units stationed on a Pa.

uniques.name: The Long Count
uniques.value: After researching Theology, receive a bonus Great Person at the end of every Maya Long Count calendar cycle (every 394 years). Each bonus person can only be chosen once.

uniques.name: Pyramid
uniques.value: Unique building of the Mayan civilization. Replaces the Shrine.

uniques.name: Atlatlist
uniques.value: Unique ranged unit of the Mayan civilization, available from the start of the game. Replaces the Archer.

uniques.name: Encomienda System
uniques.value: Receive a free Worker near the Capital at Pottery. City-States that are afraid of Mexico gain 8 Influence per turn when Mexico can demand tribute from them, but does not. Units are 50% more effective at intimidating City-States.

uniques.name: Ranchero
uniques.value: Replaces Settler. Does not halt Growth to produce, but does not protect the City from starvation. Food does not contribute to its Production.

uniques.name: Hacienda
uniques.value: Replaces Windmill. +1 Production from Luxury resources, +1 Gold from Bonus resources (e.g. Wheat, Fish), and +1 Food from Strategic Resources (e.g. Horses, Iron).

uniques.name: Mongol Terror
uniques.value: Combat Strength +30% when fighting City-State units or attacking a City-State itself. All mounted and armored units have +1 Movement. In addition, upon the discovery of Chivalry, reveal an additional Horse resource tile within the borders of every existing city; these Cities yield an additional +1 Food from all Horse resources. Spawned Horses will not spawn over existing resources or features (such as forests, mountains, or Natural Wonders), but may spawn on Hills if necessary.

uniques.name: Khan
uniques.value: A Great Person, unique to the Mongolian civilization. Replaces the Great General.

uniques.name: Keshik
uniques.value: The Mongolian unique ranged mounted unit. Replaces the Knight. Requires Horses. Ranged Strength increased to 17 (from 16), Melee increased to 17 (from 15).

uniques.name: Gateway To Africa
uniques.value: Each trading partner will grant an additional +1 Gold / +1 Culture per era (3/1 Ancient, 4/2 Classical, 5/3 Medieval, etc., per partner).

uniques.name: Kasbah
uniques.value: Unique improvement of the Moroccan civilization. Requires Chivalry. +2 Food (from +1), +1 Production, +1 Gold

uniques.name: Berber Cavalry
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Moroccan civilization. Replaces the Cavalry. Requires Horses. Desert promotion also applies to Oases and Flood Plains.

uniques.name: Spring of Moses
uniques.value: Fresh Water Farms yield +1 at Mathematics rather than Civil Service.

uniques.name: Zabonah
uniques.value: Replaces the Scout. Cannot Attack. Discovers Cities [but does not meet the holder] faster than normal [ +3 tiles]. When this unit discovers a Capital or City-State, gain +10 Gold and +5 Experience. Does not upgrade from ruins.

uniques.name: Rock-Cut Tomb
uniques.value: Replaces the Canaversery. In addition of it’s usual effects, this building can only be built in a city next or on a Desert tile. +1 Food from outgoing trade routes.

uniques.name: Dutch East India Company
uniques.value: +1 Happiness from each unique Luxury in the Empire and +1 Gold from Luxury resource tiles.

uniques.name: Polder
uniques.value: Unique improvement of the Dutch civilization. Requires Guilds. May also be built by Workboats on Lakes or Coastal tiles with at least 3 adjacent land tiles.

uniques.name: Sea Beggar
uniques.value: 27 Strength (from 25), arrives with the Boarding Party II and Supply promotions. Like all other Privateers in LEKmod, heal 25 HP for each kill. No longer receives the Coastal Raider promotion.

uniques.name: Where She Goes
uniques.value: Earn 25% more Influence for completing City-State quests. Whenever you first meet a Civilization or a City-State, earn a random one-time Faith (14), Culture (8), Gold (40) or Science (12) bonus.

uniques.name: Defender
uniques.value: Replaces the Ironclad. Significantly cheaper to construct (120 hammers vs. 167). Earns a +15% Combat Bonus in friendly territory. Ignores Zone of Control (“adjacent-to-enemy” movement penalty) when within 2 tiles of a friendly City. Arrives promoted with Cover I.

uniques.name: Maori Battalion
uniques.value: Replaces Infantry. Behaves like a Marine when embarked. Receive a Combat Bonus the further this unit is away from the Capital (+2% per tile without limit). Each Battalion stationed within a City-State’s borders earns +1 Influence with that City-State each turn.

uniques.name: Castle Builders
uniques.value: All Norman Units gain +10% Combat Strength outside of friendly territory. +5 defensive Strength in every City.

uniques.name: Motte and Bailey
uniques.value: Available at Engineering. +1 Food, +1 Production. +2 Culture at Flight. Cannot be built adjacent to one another. +25% Combat Strength for units stationed on this tile.

uniques.name: Pedite
uniques.value: Replaces the Longswordsman, but is available earlier at Metal Casting (instead of Steel). 20 Strength (vs. 21). Very slightly cheaper to produce. Arrives with the Shock I promotion for free, and may construct Motte and Baileys.

uniques.name: Nordic Bounty
uniques.value: +1 Food and +1 Production from Snow. +1 Production from Tundra.

uniques.name: Ski Infantry
uniques.value: Replaces Great War Infantry. 50 Strength, Drill I, II, and Ski Infantry Promotion.

uniques.name: Stave Church
uniques.value: Replaces Temple. Decreased cost (50 Production vs. 67), and requires no Gold maintenance. +1 Faith from Coastal resources, but provides less Faith on its own.

uniques.name: Ta-Seti
uniques.value: Start with an Apedemak’s Bow.

uniques.name: Apedemak’s Bow
uniques.value: Replaces the Scout and has identical Strength, but is classified as a Ranged unit and may attack with 3 Range. Cannot upgrade from Ruins, but may upgrade into Airships like the Scout when appropriate.

uniques.name: Blast Furnace
uniques.value: Replaces Forge. Less costly to produce and does not require resources nearby. In addition to the typical perks, provides +2 Culture from Iron resources, and newly-trained Ranged, Siege and Recon units receive the Accuracy I promotion for free.

uniques.name: Oman's Pride (or something)
uniques.value: All naval units ignore Zone of Control. +8 Gold per turn from trade routes going to conquered cities [note: does not show up as gold per turn in the gold tooltip screen]

uniques.name: Baghlah
uniques.value: Replaces the Dromon. 8 base strength and Ranged strength. Has 4 base movement and receives faith from kills.

uniques.name: Minaa
uniques.value: Replaces the Harbor. Enemy naval units take 30 damage if they end their turn next to a City with this building. +5 City defence. +2 Production from outgoing trade-routes.

uniques.name: Millets
uniques.value: Each City generates +1 Local Happiness for each Religion present in the City. Receive Faith when promoting units equal to the required experience (not when insta-healing).

uniques.name: Sipahi
uniques.value: Unique mounted unit of the Ottoman Empire. Replaces the Lancer. Requires Horses. Available at Gunpowder and costs 20% less Production to train.

uniques.name: Janissary
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the Ottoman Empire. Replaces the Musketman. 20% less costly to produce.

uniques.name: The Holy See
uniques.value: +1 Food, Production, Science, Gold, Culture and Faith from all Holy Sites. Receives 2 free Delegates in the World Congress.

uniques.name: Swiss Guard
uniques.value: Replaces Landsknecht. Does not require the Mercenary Army policy, but still must be purchased. Available at Economics. Slightly more expensive to purchase, but is faster (3 Moves vs. 2) and stronger (25 Strength vs. 16). Receive Faith and Gold from kills, extra Gold from Pillaging and arrives with Medic I and II promotions. May upgrade into Riflemen.

uniques.name: St. Peter’s Basilica
uniques.value: Replaces Grand Temple. In addition to the typical perks, provides a free Cathedral in the City, and a Great Prophet appears.

uniques.name: Achaemenid Legacy
uniques.value: Golden Ages last 50% longer. During a Golden Age, units receive +1 Movement and a +10% Combat Strength bonus.

uniques.name: Immortal
uniques.value: The Persian unique front-line unit. Replaces the Spearman.

uniques.name: Satrap's Court
uniques.value: Unique building of the Persian civilization. Requires Market. Replaces the Bank.

uniques.name: Skillful Traders
uniques.value: +25% Trade Route slot capacity. Sea Trade Routes gain 50% increased range. Start with a Square Sail Ship.

uniques.name: Square Sail Ship
uniques.value: Replaces the Trireme. May immediately enter Deep Ocean, and is slightly cheaper (25 hammers vs. 30).

uniques.name: Trade Harbour
uniques.value: Replaces the Harbor. In addition to the typical perks, provides +15% production towards Naval units and +1 Production from all Coastal resources.

uniques.name: Solidarity
uniques.value: 10% cheaper Social Policies (from 20%).

uniques.name: Ducal Stable
uniques.value: Unique building of the Polish civilization. Replaces the Stable.

uniques.name: Winged Hussar
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Polish civilization. Replaces the Lancer. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Wayfinding
uniques.value: All embarked units also have +1 movement and extra defense.

uniques.name: Moai
uniques.value: Unique improvement of the Polynesian civilization. Requires Construction.

uniques.name: Maori Warrior
uniques.value: Replaces the Longswordsman. 23 Strength (vs. 21), requires no Iron resources, and arrives with the Amphibious promotion. Obsolete at Rifling.

uniques.name: Mare Clausum
uniques.value: Caravans and Cargo Ships are also 25% less costly to construct.

uniques.name: Feitoria
uniques.value: Replaces Harbor. +1 Gold from Coastal resources, +15% Production for Naval units. Slightly cheaper to build and doesn’t require Gold maintenance.

uniques.name: Nau
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Portuguese civilization. Replaces the Caravel.

uniques.name: Army with a State
uniques.value: All Prussian trained land units may receive unique Prussian Promotions upon leveling up. (Paradropping units can’t pick the extra attack promotion). +50% Production and Food from internal Trade Routes.

uniques.name: Fabrik
uniques.value: Replaces the Factory. 25% cheaper to produce and does not require Coal resources.

uniques.name: Landwehr
uniques.value: Replaces Rifleman. 34 Strength, available at Military Science, starts with Blitz and Quick Study. Has unique promotions.

uniques.name: Nihil Sine Deo
uniques.value: All Romanian Units earn 25% of foe’s Combat Strength as Science and Culture upon victory. Units gain a +10% Combat Bonus against wounded foes. +25% Culture output during Golden Ages.

uniques.name: Vanator
uniques.value: Replaces Gatling Gun. 31 Strength and 2 Range (vs. 1).

uniques.name: Painted Monastery
uniques.value: Replaces the Garden. In addition to the typical perks, provides +2 Faith and 1 Great Artist point per turn. Does not require freshwater.

uniques.name: The Glory of Rome
uniques.value: +25% Production towards any buildings that already exist in the Capital.

uniques.name: Ballista
uniques.value: Unique siege unit of the Roman civilization. Replaces the Catapult. Has Indirect Fire.

uniques.name: Legion
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the Roman civilization. Replaces the Swordsman. Requires Iron.

uniques.name: Siberian Riches
uniques.value: Strategic Resources provide +1 Production, and Horse, Iron and Uranium Resources provide double quantity.

uniques.name: Krepost
uniques.value: Unique building of the Russian civilization. Replaces the Barracks.

uniques.name: Cossack
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Russian civilization. Replaces the Cavalry. Requires Horses. Bonus vs. wounded foes reduced from 33% to 25%.

uniques.name: Flower of Scotland
uniques.value: +2 Production, Science and Culture from Writer's, Artist's and Musician's Guilds. +33% faster Great Person generation in the Capital.

uniques.name: Gallowglass
uniques.value: Replaces Rifleman. Cheaper and available at Metallurgy (instead of Rifling). 29 Strength. Arrives with Altitude Training and Volley. Requires 1 Iron resource to train.

uniques.name: Ceilidh Hall
uniques.value: Identical to vanilla Celts.

uniques.name: Great Expanse
uniques.value: Founded cities start with 4 additional tiles (from 8). Units receive a 15% combat bonus when fighting within their own territory.

uniques.name: Pathfinder
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Shoshone civilization. Replaces the Scout. Available right from the start of the game. 27 hammers to produce (from 30).

uniques.name: Comanche Riders
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Shoshone civilization. Replaces Cavalry. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Father Governs Children
uniques.value: Food, Culture and Faith from friendly City-States increased by 50%.

uniques.name: Wat
uniques.value: Unique building of the Siamese civilization. Requires Library. Replaces the University.

uniques.name: Naresuan’s Elephant
uniques.value: Unique mounted unit of the Siamese civilization. Replaces the Knight.

uniques.name: Dwellers of the Plains
uniques.value: All Sioux units receive a +15% Combat Bonus in Plains.

uniques.name: Buffalo Hunter
uniques.value: Replaces Composite Bowman. 12 Ranged Strength (vs. 11), 8 Melee (vs. 7). Can construct Tipis.

uniques.name: Tipi
uniques.value: Can only be constructed on flat Plains or flatland Deer / Bison resources and must be adjacent to a Luxury resource. Provides +1 Food, +1 Faith. Bonus +1 Culture if adjacent to a city and +1 Gold if adjacent to a River. Gains +1 Food at Civil Service and +1 Faith at Theology. Available at Trapping.

uniques.name: River Warlord
uniques.value: Instead of the War Canoes promotion, provides unimpeded movement when moving along or across Rivers.

uniques.name: Mud Pyramid Mosque
uniques.value: Unique building of the Songhai civilization. Requires Shrine. Replaces the Temple.

uniques.name: Mandekalu Cavalry
uniques.value: The Songhai civilization's unique mounted unit. Replaces the Knight. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Seven Cities of Gold
uniques.value: Grants 100 Gold (vs. 500 for first finder, and 100 after) upon discovering a Natural Wonder.

uniques.name: Plaza de Toros
uniques.value: Replaces Circus. +2 Culture, may also be built with an improved source of Cattle.

uniques.name: Tercio
uniques.value: Unique Renaissance Era unit of the Spanish civilization. Replaces the Musketman.

uniques.name: Cradle of Civilization
uniques.value: +2 Culture from every City upon the discovery of Drama and Poetry.

uniques.name: Ziggurat
uniques.value: Replaces Temple. +2 Faith, +5% Science. Only costs 1 Gold to maintain (vs. 2).

uniques.name: Phalanx
uniques.value: Replaces Spearman. Available at Mining. 11 Strength, +50% Flanking bonus, slightly cheaper to produce.

uniques.name: Nobel Prize
uniques.value: +20% Great Person points in all cities.

uniques.name: Carolean
uniques.value: Replaces Musketman. 24 Strength, free March promotion.

uniques.name: Falu Gruva
uniques.value: Replaces Ironworks. +1 Production from Hills in the City. +6 Tourism at Flight.

uniques.name: Eightfold Path to Nirvana
uniques.value: Receive +2 Food, Production, Gold, Culture, Faith and Science in the capital upon the discovery of Drama and Poetry. +1 to those yields at Education, Acoustics, Industrialization, Radio, Radar and Globalization.

uniques.name: Dalai Lama
uniques.value: Replaces Great Prophets generated and received by Tibet. No vision penalty and may spread Religion 1 extra time. May also start 7-turn Golden Ages (consuming the unit).

uniques.name: Monastery
uniques.value: Can only be built on Hills. Provides +2 Faith and +1 Culture, +1 additional Faith at Theology. +1 Culture for each adjacent Mountain. May be built in Forests and Jungles without removing them.

uniques.name: Ulugh Beg’s Observatory
uniques.value: +5 Combat Strength and +10% Science, Production, Gold and Culture in the original Capital. These bonuses are terminated if the original Capital is captured.

uniques.name: Marathi Rider
uniques.value: Medieval Air unit, available at Chivalry. Replaces Horsemen. Requires 1 Horse, has 4 Range and 21 Combat Strength. Behaves as an Air unit, and receives the appropriate promotions.

uniques.name: Serai
uniques.value: Replaces Caravansary. +1 Gold for every 3 Citizens in the City, allows units to Airlift between Cities with Serais and increases Air unit capacity by 1.

uniques.name: The Friendly Islands
uniques.value: +1 Gold and Science for every 5 Citizens in a City.

uniques.name: Matato'a
uniques.value: Replaces the Archer (but does not require Archery to produce). +1 Movement and +1 Sight; these bonuses are lost with upgrades. Obsolete at Machinery.

uniques.name: Mala’e
uniques.value: Replaces the Granary. Available at Sailing. Significantly cheaper to construct (30 hammers vs. 40), and provides +2 Food if the city is adjacent to at least 3 Coastal tiles.

uniques.name: Westernization
uniques.value: Amphitheaters, Opera Houses, Museums and Broadcast Towers are built 50% faster and each provide 1 Science and Production. +1 Production and Science from Great Works.

uniques.name: Kuva-yi Milliye
uniques.value: Replaces Great War Infantry. Weaker (46 Strength vs. 50), +1 Movement. +25% Combat Bonus when a Great General is near (updated whenever you move the unit, or when you move the General and the unit has movement left) and Upgrades for free.

uniques.name: Halkevleri
uniques.value: Replaces the Public School. In addition to typical perks, provides +3 Culture and is 20% cheaper to construct.

uniques.name: Unknown
uniques.value: Upon completing a Wonder, receive 100 gold and start a We Love The King Day [15 turns, stacks with an existing kingsday] in the city where it is built. All Units gain +3 Gold per turn and +1 Experience on tiles with a Trading Route

uniques.name: Burj
uniques.value: Replaces the Hotel. In addition to the usual effects of a Hotel, this building gives +2 Gold and +2 Culture to Great Person Improvements and Desert tiles (except floodplains).

uniques.name: Qasimi Raider
uniques.value: Replaces the Privateer. 20% Cheaper. Gains double the amount of Gold when pillaging Trade Routes and Attacking Cities. +2 Movement.

uniques.name: The Way of Chumaks
uniques.value: +1 Food from Maize, Wheat and Salt resources after researching The Wheel.

uniques.name: Zaphorosian Cossack
uniques.value: Replaces Lancer. Arrives with Shock 1 and a +25% Combat Bonus in friendly territory.

uniques.name: Knyaz Court
uniques.value: Replaces Market. +2 Gold, +25% gold, Receive 20 Gold per Knyaz Court when a Great Person is consumed.

uniques.name: Serenissima
uniques.value: Capable of producing Settlers. Sea trade routes cannot be plundered. Receive a Free Trade Route and Cargo Ship when Compass is researched.

uniques.name: Merchant of Venice
uniques.value: A unique Great Person of the Venetian civilization, specialized in Trading. Replaces the Great Merchant.

uniques.name: Grand Canal
uniques.value: Replaces East India Company. Provides +2 Trade Routes, +25% Gold and +4 Gold. Increased Gold from Trade Routes. Does not require Markets and is available at Currency (instead of Guilds).

uniques.name: Tam Giao
uniques.value: +2 Food, +1 Production from Marsh. +1 Faith from Jungle. Units receive double Movement through Marshes and Jungles, and receive a Combat Bonus in Marshes (+30%) and Jungles (+15%).

uniques.name: Viet Cong
uniques.value: Replaces Infantry. 70 Strength, is Invisible except to adjacent units and can traverse mountains, taking 50 HP damage if they end their turn on one. NOTE - MAY CAUSE CRACHES WHEN CAPTURING CITIES, RECOMMENDED TO USE OTHER UNITS.

uniques.name: Vo Khi
uniques.value: Replaces Armory. Available at Metal Casting, +1 Food, +1 Culture and +1 Production from Marsh. +1 Culture from Jungle. All melee units trained in a city with a Vo Khi receive the Woodsman promotion. Doesn’t require Barracks.

uniques.name: Hafod a Hendref
uniques.value: +1 Food and +1 Gold from Sheep. All units receive a 15% Combat Bonus fighting on Hills.

uniques.name: Saethwyr
uniques.value: Replaces Crossbowman. 15 Combat Strength (vs. 13).

uniques.name: Caer
uniques.value: Unique Improvement unlocked at Chivalry. +25% Defense on this tile, +3 Gold, +1 Culture, and +1 Production. +1 Culture at Acoustics. Receives yields from certain policies. May only be built on Hills without resources.

uniques.name: Great Zimbabwe
uniques.value: +25% Production towards military units and all buildings in the Capital (Guilds, National and World Wonders do not count as buildings).

uniques.name: Shona Warrior
uniques.value: Replaces the Warrior. 9 Strength (vs. 8) and is capable of building Quarries and Farms.

uniques.name: Stone Mason
uniques.value: Replaces Stoneworks. Does not provide Happiness, but is 20% cheaper to produce and provides +2 Culture. Doesn’t require resources to construct.

uniques.name: Iklwa
uniques.value: Melee units cost 50% less maintenance. All units require 25% less experience to earn their next promotion

uniques.name: Ikanda
uniques.value: Unique building of the Zulu civilization. Replaces the Barracks.

uniques.name: Impi
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Zulu civilization. Replaces the Pikeman.
